intro: Galium truniacum, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a slightly aromatic scent when crushed. Galium truniacum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
